Additional Details: Epicurus Social Cooperative Enterprise of Collective and Social Benefit, is a Carrier of Social and Solidarity Economy, founded by eight women, in order to support the foundations of "roads leading to the realization of utopia", for a more wise/philosophical way of living.

Name: Cooperativa Latinoamericana de Ahorro y Crédito Utrahuilca
Address: Cra 4ta No 18 - 54, Neiva, Colombia
Description: La Fundación Social Utrahuilca se fundó en 1996. Su misión es desarrollar programas sociales en los departamentos del Huila, Caquetá, Tolima, Cauca, Nariño y Putumayo, que contribuyan al buen vivir y al bien vivir de las personas que integran la región, tomando como base la economía solidaria que genere paz y armonía con el medio ambiente y las comunidades existentes.
Additional Details: Es un organismo auxiliar y autónomo del sector de la economía solidaria, con capacidad autogestionaria que lidera la educación y la integración cooperativa a nivel local, regional y nacional con el desarrollo de programas de carácter educativo, social, político, cultural, deportivo y ambiental que propenden por el multiculturalismo y la interculturalidad, basados en la igualdad y la dignidad de la persona en una economía al servicio del género humano.

Name: Coopertiva Multiactiva de Aporte y Crédito "COOMFONELEC"

Additional Details: Proporcionamos servicios financieros y complementarios a nuestros asociados que garanticen la atención de sus necesidades en un marco de solidaridad, eficiencia, beneficio mutuo y bienestar personal para sus asociados, núcleo familiar, recurso y humano y comunidad en general.

Additional Details: Buscamos fortalecer el sentido de cooperativismo entre los sectores sociales comunitarios y culturales, lo que logre ampliar las oportunidades de desarrollar ideas a proyectos artísticos y fortalecer las capacidades de artesanos y creadores que habitan áreas con menos oportunidades económicas y sociales.

Name: Co-Ooptkam Company Ltd.

Name: Motswedi SACCOS
Address: P. O. Box 81027 Gaborone, Botswana
Description: More WELCOME TO MOTSWEDI SACCOS Motswedi is a Savings and Credit Cooperative Society registered in Botswana under the Cooperative Societies Act No. 5 of 1989. Society was formed primarily to create a pool of savings and enable the members access to credit at affordable interest rates.

Name: Alberta Community and Cooperative Association
Address: Alberta Community and Co-operative Association #201, 4405 – 50 Street Stony Plain, AB T7Z 1L5 Canada
Description: The Alberta Community and Co-operative Association is a not-for-profit co-operative working for the education, development and promotion of co-operatives across Alberta. Our membership is made up of renowned national co-operatives and smaller community-minded co-operatives and organizations across all industries. Our board of directors is elected from our membership and represents many sectors important to Alberta’s communities including (but not limited to) agriculture, utilities, finance, education, housing, retail and more.
Additional Details: We host the largest co-operative youth leadership program in Canada in the summer of each year. To date, more than 45,000 young people have been involved, with 4 programs for different age groups running for 5 days each.

Name: BC Co-operative Association
Address: BC Co-op Association #503 - 535 Thurlow Street Vancouver, BC V6E 3L2 Canada
Description: The BC Co-op Association (BCCA) is the knowledge and resource centre for co-ops in BC, where co-ops and credit unions come together to collaborate, network, get support, learn, and contribute knowledge to shape BC’s co-op movement.

Name: Cyprus Turkish Co-operative Central Bank Ltd.
Address: 49 Mahmut Paşa Sokak
Description: Our institution is a cooperative bank and a member of the ICA.
Additional Details: Our bank is in a leading position of the financial sektor in northern Cyprus. We are the main Organization of 200 member subcooperatives.

Name: Kooperationen
Address: Reventlowsgade 14, 2., 1651 Copenhagen V, Denmark
Description: Kooperationen is the Danish Cooperative Employers’ Organisation with a network of 92 member companies and 14.000 employees. As the apex organization for Danish co-operatives, we promote the co-operative alternative across many sectors of the economy. Established in 1922, Kooperationen provides professional legal advice and counselling within areas such as employment law, company law and construction law. Our members represent a wide range of business fields such as the banking and insurance sector to craftsman and construction businesses, conference centres and museums. Furthermore we offer high quality professional legal and governance advice and guidance to new co-operative start-ups as well as to established co-operatives. As a cooperative employers’ organisation, we play an active role in the International Cooperative Alliance (ICA) and in Cooperatives Europe. Led by our co-operative values and principles we aim to bring together all those with a passion and interest in co-operative action and we run our business solely for the benefit of our members. And that is precisely what makes us a bit different from other conventional employers’ organisations in Denmark. Kooperationen is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Description: Ghana Cooperatives Council is the apex body for all Cooperatives in the country. Association comes together to form this cooperative. Its main objective is to be the mouthpiece for Cooperatives in terms of national policies, advocacy and capacity building

Name: National Auditing Union of Workers' Cooperatives
Address:
00-680 Warszawa,
ul. Żurawia 47
Description: NAUWC is a voluntary and self-governing organisation, which associates labour cooperatives and cooperative organisations in Poland. It was established in Warsaw on 14th November 1991. It has the status of a legal person and acts pursuant to the Cooperative Law of 16th September 1982, the amendment of this Law of 7th July and several other laws as well as on the basis of its own Articles of Association. NAUWC is a signatory of the main self-governing body of the Polish cooperative movement - the National Cooperative Council, in which it has 13% of seats and the following positions: Vice-President of the Management Board, Chairman of the Auditing Commission and Vice-Chairman of the Auditing Commission and Economic and Legal Commission. NAUWC is a member of ICA, CICOPA; and of CECOP. The President of the Management Board of the NAUWC is the member of CECOP Board and CICOPA Executive Committee. NAUWC has received the highest cooperative decoration in Poland "For Cooperative Merits", awarded by the National Cooperative Council in 1999. NAUWC awards especially meritorious cooperatives and their members with Honorary Distinctions "For Labour Cooperative Movement Merits" and "Person of Merits for Labour Cooperative Movement". NAUWC has been publishing bimonthly "Information Bulletin of the National Auditing Union of Workers’ Co-operatives" since 1992. The Bulletin is directed to the self-government organs of workers’ cooperatives, inspectors and certified accountants/auditors of the workers’ cooperative movement, universities and scientific & research institutions which study the cooperative movement issues.

Name: Link Cooperatives International, CRL
Address: Rua de S. Roque da Lameira nº 1351 4350-314 Porto, Portugal
Description: Mission: Connect and promote the dialogue and the active involvement of national and international cooperatives in the exchange of knowledge, ideas and talents for the regeneration of sociocultural values and emerging needs of a changing society.
Additional Details: Link Cooperatives International, CRL (Link) is a cooperative start-up based on the commitments of "Co-ops for 2030" program. Good Health and Well-Being (Objective 3); Sustainable Cities and Communities (Objective 11); Responsible Consumption and Production (Objective 12); Partnerships for The Goals (Objective 17) These are the main goals of our work through the development of services in four distinct areas: Health and Care, Hospitality and Tourism, Business and Entrepreneurship and Sustenable and Green Economy, connected by linked services and intercooperation Values Link will honour the principles of cooperatives stipulated by the International Co-operative Alliance (ICA), aligning all the procedures and future view with the United Nations (UN) and European Union (EU) objectives and regulations. ▪ Voluntary and Free Membership; ▪ Democratic management by members; ▪ Members' economic participation; ▪ Autonomy and independence; ▪ Education, training and information; ▪ Intercooperation; ▪ Community interest. Health&Care Link Cooperatives specific intervention area dedicate to healthcare and wellbeing, LinkHealth&Care. The main objectives are the promotion of healthcare services of our cooperators providers, creation of national and international synergies for innovation, consulting, development, sharing and training. Facilitate, integrate and innovate are the keywords. Homecare Services, Homecare support devices, Accessibility Solutions, Senior Residence are some of our services and projects. Good Health and Well-Being (Objective 3) for the commitments of "Co-ops for 2030" program. Hospitality and Tourism Link Cooperatives specific intervention area dedicate to hospitality and Tourism. The main objectives are the promotion of tourism services, creation of national and international synergies for innovation, cultural development and gastronomic experiences. Culture, traditions and social innovation are the keywords. Health Tourism, Historic Routes, International Gastronomy and Street Food World are some of our services and projects. Responsible Consumption and Production (Objective 12) for the commitments of "Co-ops for 2030" program. Business and Entrepreneurship Link Cooperatives specific intervention area dedicate to business and entrepreneurship. The main objectives are promotion of business consulting and advisoring in cooperative model, support and development of start-up cooperatives and creation of national and international synergies for cooperative business development and intercooperation. Intercooperation, synergy and cooperatives are the keywords. Consulting & Advisoring, Incubator&Accelerator, Coop Training, Start-up campus and Events are some of our services and projects. Partnerships for The Goals (Objective 17) for the commitments of "Co-ops for 2030" program. Sustainable and Green Economy Link Cooperatives specific intervention area dedicate to sustainable and green economy. The main objectives are the promotion sustainable cities and villages, support and development of green projects in agriculture and sustainable products, creation of national and international synergies for intercooperation and environmental projects. Intercooperation, sustainable, environmental and innovation are the keywords. Consulting, Monitoring and Education are some of our services Sustainable Cities and Communities (Objective 11) for the commitments of "Co-ops for 2030" program.

Name: Somalia Union Cooperative Movement (UDHIS)
Address: UDHIS Building Next Peace Garden, Waberi District , SYL Street . P.O. Box 48-BN -09010, Mogadishu, Somalia
Description: Somalia Union Cooperative Movement (UDHIS) is an Apex organization for all cooperatives in Somalia, It was legal entity, (Law No 40, October 4, 1973 for the Somali Cooperatives and also law No 41, October 8, 1979) which was established Somalia Union Cooperatives Movement (UDHIS). UDHIS are engaging Socio-Economic Production, which plays an important role in the production and economic development of the country.
Additional Details: Summary Profile: Somalia Union Cooperative Movement (UDHIS) Somalia Union Cooperative Movement (UDHIS) is an Apex organization for all cooperatives in Somalia, It was legal entity, (Law No 40, October 4, 1973 for the Somali Cooperatives and also law No 41, October 8, 1979) which was established Somalia Union Cooperatives Movement (UDHIS). UDHIS are engaging Socio-Economic Production, which plays an important role in the production and economic development of the country. It serves as the voice of the cooperatives movement both Nationally and Internationally, UDHIS also serves as the main cooperative policy advisor for the government. Vision A strong and vibrant of the National Federation Cooperatives with empowered members. Mission To provide high quality support services to National Federation/Union/Cooperatives and their members on a sustainable basis. Objectives The objects for which the society is established are to organize and promote the social economic interests of its members. In particular, the Cooperatives shall undertake: 1. Strengthening good governance cooperatives, enhancing social awareness, knowledge, technology and capacity of the Cooperatives members. 2. To ensure personal growth through the introduction of new products and services that will promote the economic base of the members. 3. To ensure the co-operative principle of co-operation among co-operatives in order to promote members’ interests progress of Cooperative through continuous education programs on proper use of technique, reduction of poverty, human dignity and co-operation. Services: 1. Financial services: a) Cooperative saving and credit facility b) Cooperative investment facility 2. Non-Financial services a) Agriculture, and Incense service b) Fishery service c) Livestock and Forestry service d) Industries, Handcrafts service e) Transportation service f) Consumer and Service g) Housing service Basic statistics: Description Quantity Apex of Cooperatives (UDHIS) 1 Federations 8 Unions 88 Cooperatives 2,936

Description: The NFCA is a federation of more than 35 food co-ops and start-ups, locally owned by 130,000 members.
Additional Details: In addition to peer networking, marketing, and sourcing services, we provide educational resources to our member co-ops and participate in an undergraduate certificate program in co-operative enterprise in collaboration with a local university.

Name: Conseil de la coopération de l'Ontario
Address: 223 rue Main, boîte 90, Ottawa, Ontario K1S 1C4 CANADA
Description: Le Conseil de la coopération de l'Ontario est une entreprise sociale ontarienne sans but lucratif fondée en 1964. Nous travaillons à assurer la promotion, le développement durable et l'innovation des coopératives et des entreprises sociales (que nous appelons ensemble des entreprises collectives) en Ontario, nous sommes des joueurs de premier plan du développement économique communautaire, nous faisons de la recherche et de l'innovation sociale et nous sommes experts de la gestion organisationnelle.
Additional Details: Le Conseil de la Coopération de l’Ontario (CCO) a pour mission de contribuer à l’essor de l’économie sociale dans la collectivité francophone par la coopération. Il réalise cette mission en permettant aux coopératives et entreprises sociales de se concerter, de promouvoir leurs intérêts et de soutenir leur développement.

Name: Federación de Cooperativas de Ahorro y Crédito de Honduras, Ltda. (FACACH)
Address: Colonia Palmira, Avenida Juan Lindo N°121, Tegucigalpa, Honduras
Description: FACACH es una Federación de Cooperativas de Ahorro y Crédito de segundo piso, representa y apoya a 84 Cooperativas, para que sean instituciones competitivas en el mercado financiero y ofrezcan productos y servicios accesibles, que mejoren la calidad de vida de la población hondureña.
Additional Details: FACACH constituye su Comité de Juventud en 2015, con el objetivo de apoyar a sus afiliadas en la conformación de Comités de Juventud según lo estipula La Ley de Cooperativas de Honduras y su Reglamento. Promovemos la participación de la Juventud para que sean incorporados y tomados en cuenta en las acciones que realiza cada Cooperativa dada su condición de alternativa de trabajo, espacio recreativo y formativo.

Name: CSN Cooperative Financiera
Address: Av. Republica Mexicana 401, Las Puentes @do Sector, San Nicolas de los Garza, Nueco Leon, CP 66460 Monterry, Mexico
Description: ES UNA COOPERATIVA DE AHORRO Y CREDITO
Additional Details: Es una cooperativa financiera con un gran numero de jóvenes asociados y empleados que fortalecen el desarrollo de la sociedad mediante los productos y servicios que ofrecemos

Name: AGACA
Address: Unión de Cooperativas AGACA Rúa Tomiño 22, Entreplanta 15703 Santiago de Compostela España
Description: AGACA se centra en la representación y defensa del cooperativismo agroalimentario. Pero, además, prestamos servicios de apoyo a las cooperativas relacionados con diversos ámbitos y realizamos actividades de promoción y formación. Servicios: asesoría económica y jurídica, calidad alimentaria, comunicación, medioambiente, seguros,.. Promoción: incorporación de jóvenes a la agricultura y a las cooperativas, incorporación de mujeres a los órganos sociales de las cooperativas, atención y cuidado a los mayores del rural, atención a la alimentación de la infancia en las ciudades,.. Formación: agricultores, socios de cooperativas, rectores y dirigentes.
Additional Details: AGACA, conjuntamente con otras entidades, estamos a desarrollar un programa Erasmus+ para jóvenes y mujeres. El proyecto se llama Erasmus + LeadFarm. Los socios del proyecto son Icos de Irlanda, Services Coop. de France de Francia, Changemaker de Suecia y LLKC de Letonia. El Proyecto LeadFarm, cofinanciado por el programa Erasmus+ de la Unión Europea, tiene por objetivo conseguir un equilibrio generacional y de género en las cooperativas agrarias a través del fortalecimiento de las capacidades de los jóvenes, para garantizar el cambio generacional en las explotaciones familiares y en las cooperativas. Específicamente, el Proxecto LeadFarm pretende: ofrecer formación innovadora a los jóvenes para mejorar sus conocimientos cooperativos y su área operativa; promover la cultura y valores cooperativos para proporcionar una mejor comprensión de la cooperativa a la juventud, aumentando su nivel de participación y compromiso; fortalecer las habilidades gerenciales para su profesionalización y de su familia; y, finalmente, promover el equilibrio de género en los consejos rectores de las cooperativas y otros órganos de la entidad. En definitiva, LeadFarm pretende lograr contenidos innovadores sobre Gestión de Explotaciones y sobre Cultura y Valores Cooperativos. Para eso, dispondremos en el proyecto de una plataforma TIC para apoyar el aprendizaje, con gestión interactiva de contenidos, varios juegos cooperativos para trabajar los valores de las mismas, formación de formadores, formación piloto para beneficiarios finales, tres seminarios de presentación de resultados intelectuales, y dos Movilidades Combinadas para jóvenes agricultores de Irlanda, Suecia, España, Francia y Letonia.

Name: FEVECTA
Address: FEVECTA Arzobispo Mayoral 11 bajo 46002 Valencia, Spain
Description: FEVECTA es la Federaciñón de cooeprativas de trabajo asociado. En 2017 FEVECTA ha cumplido su 30 aniversario. El nacimiento de la Federación viene a cubrir una necesidad de representación global del sector surgida en los años 80 del Siglo XX entre las cooperativas industriales y de producción. El cooperativismo de aquellos años está poco organizado y se suscita la necesidad de proveerse de una entidad sólida que le asegure la defensa de sus intereses. Así nació FEVECTA. En estas tres décadas, la Federación se ha convertido en una entidad consolidada y de prestigio dentro del panorama socioeconómico valenciano. Como parte de su misión de representación y defensa de los intereses del sector, ha estado siempre al lado de las cooperativas federadas: Próxima a sus diferentes realidades y a la diversidad sectorial y territorial; conociendo sus problemáticas para proponer soluciones de mejora, bien por la vía legislativa bien mediante la interlocución política o técnica; canalizando sus peticiones y aspiraciones hacia las diferentes administraciones competentes; ayudándoles para superar sus dificultades, y siendo partícipes de sus éxitos.
Additional Details: FEVECTA basa sus actuaciones en torno a tres grandes pilares: Defensa de los intereses de las cooperativas FEVECTA es la entidad representativa de las cooperativas de Trabajo Asociado de la Comunidad Valenciana, en los ámbitos económico, político y social, ante las entidades públicas y privadas, y en el seno del movimiento cooperativo en general, adoptando para tal fin todas las acciones que considere oportunas. Promoción y fomento del cooperativismo La Federación orienta y asesora a los grupos de personas que pretenden constituir una cooperativa. Si estás interesado en crear una cooperativa de trabajo asociado, puedes dirigirte al servicio de atención a emprendedores en cualquiera de nuestras sedes de Valencia, Castellón y Alicante donde te atenderemos de manera totalmente gratuita + INFO. Servicios a las cooperativas asociadas* FEVECTA pone a disposición de las cooperativas y de aquellos profesionales que les asesoran un equipo técnico especializado que ofrece servicios de: Asesoramiento jurídico-económico Servicios cooperativos (información de subvenciones, trámites registrales, adaptación y modificación de estatutos sociales, asesoramiento y diseño del RRI, etc.). Formación profesional y societaria. Información empresarial de interés para las cooperativas. Gestión de proyectos de Desarrollo empresarial. Apoyo a la creación de cooperativas. Edición de publicaciones prácticas para la gestión cooperativa. Otros servicios.

Name: Confederación Uruguaya de Entidades Cooperativas (CUDECOOP)
Address: Avenida 18 de julio 948 apto 602, Montevideo, Uruguay
Description: CUDECOOP representa al conjunto del movimiento cooperativo uruguayo (más de 3.500 cooperativas de base). Su actividad central es gremial pero también desarrolla programas de formación y desarrollo, entre las que se destaca por su impacto a nivel juvenil, la Incubadora de Cooperativas (INCUBACOOP.)
Additional Details: La Confederación realiza actividades organizadas en varias dimensiones: (a) representación gremial a nivel Nacional e Internacional; (b) cogestión de políticas públicas (cuenta con delegados en la dirección de 3 organismos y otros ámbitos de diálogo e incidencia); (c) gobernanza del Movimiento; (d) Desarrollo Cooperativo (incluye educación, investigación y promoción de cooperativas a través de múltiples instrumentos); (e) Visibilidad / Comunicación (difunde el quehacer cooperativo y el posicionamiento del Movimiento).

Name: Cooperativas Agrarias Federadas
Address: 11000 Montevideo, Uruguay
Description: CAF representa una red integrada por mas de 20 cooperativas agrarias y sociedades de fomento rural del Uruguay con más de 13000 asociados, distribuidos en todo el territorio nacional.
Additional Details: Agrarian cooperatives as formal legal entities arise in Uruguay in 1941, as of the approval of Law 10,008. However, cooperativism in the agricultural sector has a much earlier history, dating back to the first decades of the twentieth century, with the emergence of the first Rural Development Societies and Agricultural Unions, solidarity organizations operating very similar to those current agrarian cooperatives.

Name: Cooperative Agraria Ltda Mercedes (CALMER)
Address: AV. Lavalleja Nº 649 75000 - Mercedes - Mazzilli, Uruguay
Description: • Somos una Cooperativa de productores que piensa en cómo potenciar su negocio. • Estamos en los distintos eslabones de la cadena desde la producción y comercialización. • Conocemos la actividad y tenemos un equipo con fuerte compromiso para apoyarlo en el manejo de los riesgos.
Additional Details: • Financiación de cultivos para granos, semillas y pasturas. • Asesoramiento técnico en cultivos. • Venta de insumos agropecuarios. • Servicio de logística para mover su cosecha. • Comercialización de granos. • Mercado de granos: Informe semanal, asesoramiento profesional personalizado y coberturas. • Comercialización de semilla forrajera • Asesoramiento post- cosecha. • Planta de acopio con planes especiales. • Laboratorio: Servicio calificado en análisis de semillas y granos. • Recibo, monitoreo y procesamiento de su semilla, en especies forrajera, cultivos de invierno y verano. • Producción de raciones CALMER (Destete precoz, Recría, Engorde y Lechera). • Molienda, mezclas y aditivos según sus necesidades. • Asesoramiento profesional en temas de nutrición animal. • Reservas Forrajeras: Servicio de enfardado y silo pack. • Comercialización de lana (Central Lanera Uruguaya). • Seguros: Cultivos - vivienda – automotriz - de vida.

Name: Cooperatives Europe
Address: Rue du Trône 4 1000 Bruxelles, Belgique
Description: Cooperatives Europe est l'organisation représentative des entreprises coopératives en Europe. Nous soutenons l'animation et le développement du Young European Cooperators' Network (YECN), impliquant 150 individus de 17 pays européens ainsi que 4 réseaux nationaux. À travers le YECN, nous souhaitons créer les conditions pour : - renforcer la voix des jeunes dans les affaires publiques, à travers le mouvement coopératif ; - stimuler l'innovation coopérative, en créant les espaces d'échanges entre représentants de fédérations coopératives et acteurs de l'innovation ; - favoriser l'émergence de projets entrepreneuriaux basés sur le modèle coopératif.

Name: COOPSCO / Fédération québécoise des coopératives en milieu scolaire
Address: 7333, place des Roseraies, bureau 501 Anjou QC H1M 2X6 Canada
Description: Fondée le 12 novembre 1983, la Fédération québécoise des coopératives en milieu scolaire (FQCMS) est l’organisme provincial qui représente les coopératives en milieu scolaire membres COOPSCO, les soutient dans la réalisation de leur plan d’affaires et les appuie dans leur offre de services auprès de leurs membres propriétaires. NOTRE MISSION ASSURER LA PÉRENNITÉ ET LE DÉVELOPPEMENT DE NOS MEMBRES. La Fédération : • exerce un leadership mobilisateur pour assurer leur développement associatif et économique; • les représente et défend leurs intérêts communs; • fait la promotion des valeurs coopératives et du développement durable.
Additional Details: NOS MEMBRES Sous la bannière COOPSCO, la FQCMS regroupe soixante (60) coopératives en milieu scolaire présentes dans plus de quatre-vingt-dix (90) établissements scolaires totalisant 98 points de service librairies et 98 points de services alimentaires dans des écoles secondaires, des collèges et des universités francophones du Québec, ainsi que deux points de vente en Ontario.

Name: Fédération des unions des sociétés coopératives des Producteurs de la filière Coton de Côte d'Ivoire (FPC-CI)
Address: 17 BP 988 Abidjan 17 Côte d'Ivoire
Description: La Fédération des unions des sociétés coopératives des Producteurs de la filière Coton de Cote d’Ivoire en abrégé FPC-CI est l’organisation faîtière qui représente l’ensemble des producteurs de coton de Côte d’Ivoire. A ce titre, elle est l’interlocuteur des producteurs auprès des pouvoirs public et privé et parle donc en leur nom. Elle a été créée en Décembre 2013 en remplacement de l’ex Association des Faitières de la Filière Coton en Côte d’Ivoire (AFFICOTCI), pour se conformer à l’acte uniforme OHADA relative au Sociétés Coopératives. La FPC-CI est membre de l’organisation interprofessionnelle agricole de la filière coton (INTERCOTON) aux cotés de l’Association Professionnelle des sociétés cotonnières de Côte d’Ivoire et les autres acteurs. Elle est également membre de l’Association des Producteurs de Coton d’Afrique (APROCA) et membre de l’Alliance Coopérative Internationale (ACI). Elle a pour mission principale l’amélioration de la situation socio-économique de ses membres.
Additional Details: La FPC-CI compte six (6) unions membres qui regroupe plus de 300 sociétés coopératives. Elle compte près de 110 000 producteurs membres.

Name: Centre d'Education Integree (CEI)
Address: Jacmel, Lamontagne Bellevue HT 9110 Haiti
Description: Nous sommes un Centre d Education Integree qui valorise les ressources locales et qui encourage l'engagement communautaire et le leadership responsables des jeunes.
Additional Details: La CEI dirige une ecole qui a plus de 175 eleves, dont Chaque class a un comite. cette structure organisationnelle est responsable des projets de classe,et des projets de l'ecole ainsi que des projets para sclolaires. les jeunes deviendront acteur de leur propre avenir.

Name: Fundación Mapocho
Address: Av. Bustamante 26, Providencia, Santiago 7500776, CL
Description: Fundación Mapocho is a NGO that works on impact agents empowerment through communication skills and discourse framing. It started organizing independent TED events (under the TEDx license) in vulnerable areas of Santiago, an now it has continued to work with different social agents to mobilize and visibilize their ideas, working specifically with cooperatives and young cooperators in the country.

Name: CCUA - National Young Leaders Committee
Address: 151 Yonge St #1000, Toronto, ON M5C 2W7 Canada
Description: The Canadian Credit Union Association (CCUA) is the national credit union trade association, representing Canada’s credit unions, caisses populaires (outside of Quebec), and regional credit union Central organizations. CCUA is distinct in its commitment to co-operative values, and is the first, national credit union governed organization in Canada. The National Young Leaders Committee (NYLC) is a team of up-and-coming credit union professionals from across the country, working to strengthen the Canadian credit union system by bridging generations of leadership. We're a connection point between today's young leaders, experienced leaders and the leadership roles that will shape Canada's credit union system of tomorrow.

Name: Cinéma du Désert
Address: n/a
Description: Empowering people through storytelling. Cinema du Desert is a Solar Powered Mobile Cinema that has, since 2009, traveled the world overland bringing free cinema, play and joy to some of the most remote areas on the planet. Counting 5 tours in North and West Africa and a 9-month journey through Central Asia. Our activities are self-funded through fundraising while, simultaneously, working as social volunteers for Italian NGO Bambini Nel Deserto.
Additional Details: We believe that free access to culture is the foundation for a better tomorrow, so we keep on spreading seeds and making contacts around the globe because good health also passes through culture and education. We are strong believers in eco-responsibility, self-sustainability and the idea that Education = Dignity.  We use the power of images to create a bridge between cultures - so to deepen the dialogue about the dangers of globalization and the challenges ahead - with the hope of developing sustainable social projects on the field whilst traveling and being creative at the same time!

Name: Social Investment Programme
Address: n/a
Description: Social investment programme
Additional Details: Youth empowerment programme.

Name: Youth Association for Development
Address: E-26- Muslim Town, Officers Colony, Link Shabo Road Tajjak Abad Quetta, Baluchistan, Pakistan
Description: The Youth Association for Development (YAD) is a youth lead, peace building civil society initiative based in Baluchistan and whose roots lies with a core of volunteers in different districts of Pakistan. YAD is human rights based approach with a multi sector development organization working on participatory development approach to bring long term change & sustainable development in the society. The idea of a civil society organization evolved in 2002, when a group of like minded people working in the social, political, human rights and development sector in Baluchistan and having enough international exposure and experience, got together and initiated the dialogue among themselves on issues of humanism, peace, democracy, human rights, right to information, transparency, accountability, environment, water, sanitation, hygiene, health, education & other social issues in the province and country; The group concluded the need for an organization which can address the above mentioned issues through a holistic approach; promote the value of peace and basic human rights; address democratic and governance issues; conduct research and analysis; initiate dialogues among different segments of society; take steps toward a peaceful, tolerant, and democratic society, conservation of environment & natural resources management, sanitation improvement & hygiene education, working for IWRM and provide an enabling environment to civil society of Baluchistan. Legal status  The Youth Association for Development (YAD) is registered under the societies Act 1860 with the Directorate societies, industries & production Department Baluchistan under registration No. 1021, Dated, 10-06-2005
Additional Details: YAD Vision YAD envisions "a Peaceful, Equitable, tolerant, just and Democratic World & to bring socio-economic development in the rural and urban communities."  Mission To promote and protect peace, social & interfaith harmony, democracy, human rights and social development in Pakistan through, mobilization, awareness, research, dialogues, advocacy and trainings. Objectives: • To promote and protect basic human rights particularly of women and minorities; • To contribute to the creation of a tolerant society through the promotion of the value of peace and human rights; • To promote interfaith harmony & social harmony. • To promote democracy & good governance in the society • To mobilize the stakeholders for social development. • To encourage and support democratic norms, values, and institutions in the society; • To incorporate gender sensitization in all program activities and to make gender a cross cutting theme. • To protect environment, water conservation & natural resources management. • To promote health, hygiene & sanitation improvement • To increase literacy trough quality education , research & public private partnership development.

Name: Woodcraft Folk
Address: Units 9 & 10, 83 Crampton Street, London, SE17 3BQ UK
Description: Woodcraft Folk is a youth charity which runs over 300 local youth groups and 6 residential centres for children and young people.
Additional Details: Education Centres are: Biblins, HR9 6DX Cudham, TN16 2HT Lockerbrook, S330BJ Darsham, IP17 3PL Heightgate, Todmorden Park Farm, GU28 9EU

Description: es una cooperativa de ahorro y crédito comprometida con el bienestar social de sus afiliados.
Additional Details: Nuestra cooperativa realmente se empodero del desafío de integrar a la juventud al movimiento cooperativo, por lo que realiza una gran inversión en las actividades de inclusión que realiza el comité de juventud.

Name: Soluciones Ciudadanas para la equidad el desarrollo, A.C.
Address: Cabo verde # 18 Col. Gabriel Hernández C.P. 07080 Av. de los arcos # 36 B 47 Col. Parque Industrial Naucalpan EDO.MEX.
Description: Nos dedicamos a capacitar, orientar, asistir y apoyar a jóvenes estudiantes y trabajadores, para que sean sus propios gestadores de crecimiento, a través de que desarrollen habilidades y competencias que les ayuden a conseguir mejores oportunidades laborales y académicas.
Additional Details: Somos una A.C. sin fiens elucros y tambien somos una Incubadora de negocios que ayuda a los jóvenes a detectar oportunidades de negocios para que ellos invertan en ellas a travpes d ela creación d eempresas.

Name: Andariega Hemp
Address: 11800, Barrio Aguada, Montevideo, Uruguay
Description: Somos un colectivo de personas activistas de la agroindustria y textil, unidos para empoderar la industria nacional del agro y el textil. Hoy creando demanda, producimos prendas recicladas con agregados de Cáñamo intervenidos con Ecoprint, método de teñido ecológico, apuntando a un parate al fast fashion y motivando la innovación y sostenibilidad.
Additional Details: Estamos instalados en un Enlace Cowork, espacio de trabajo colaborativo. Aquí compartimos espacio con 35 emprendimientos más en muchas ramas. Buscamos colaborar de forma activa en la participación social del joven emprendedor con apuesta cooperativista. Nuestro espacio de taller textil y de motivación esta abierto.

Name: Action Sociale et d'Organisation Paysanne ASOP/Youlima
Address: 1991 Bukavu, Democratic Republic of Congo
Description: Youlima etymologiquement est formé de 2 mots le Youth : jeunesse et Lima : labourer. Il signifie Jeunesse en agriculture. Le Youlima est un réseau des entreprises des jeunes travaillant dans le domaine agricole. Les entreprises membres du Youlima sont féderées pour les échanges d'experience, la formation en techniques de production et de gestion, la conception de plan d'affaire, l'experimentation des idées d'entreprise, la réception du capital de demarage ou mise en contact avec une Banque et le mentorat. Les jeunes projetent créent leur proore institution de finance grâce aux intérets générés de leurs projet.

Name: Agricultores Federados Argentinos Sociedad Cooperativa Ltda
orgnasationtype: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Sector: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Address: Mitre 1132, Rosario, Argentina
Description: Jóvenes AFA es una agrupación de Agricultores Federados Argentinos Sociedad Cooperativa Limitada compuesta por hijos de Asociados, de empleados de la Cooperativa o relacionados al medio rural que se interesan por la doctrina cooperativa y el sector agropecuario. Actualmente, Jóvenes AFA cuenta con 150 jóvenes nucleados en 20 Grupos de Jóvenes AFA en localidades de las provincias de Santa Fe, Buenos Aires y Córdoba donde la Cooperativa posee presencia arraigada. Misión: Fomentar la Educación en la Doctrina Cooperativa y Agropecuaria en todos sus aspectos, para lograr el desarrollo de los Jóvenes en nuestras comunidades. Trabajar en la formación de Dirigentes, mediante los Principios y Valores Cooperativos, con el fin de mejorar el capital humano y el bienestar de las familias argentinas. Visión: Un grupo de jóvenes formados dentro de la doctrina cooperativa y agropecuaria sosteniendo como estandarte el Asociativismo y la defensa de los Principios, Valores Cooperativos y, sobre todo, a nuestra entidad como herramienta para garantizar la subsistencia de los pequeños y medianos productores en el sistema económico. Apostamos a la construcción colectiva en la búsqueda de soluciones a cuestiones que atañen no solo al medio rural, sino también a la comunidad en su conjunto. Nos comprometemos con la comunidad y el desarrollo de la misma en todos sus aspectos (económico, social, cultural) y buscamos permanentemente el desarrollo integral de las familias Argentina.
Additional Details: Actualmente nuestra juventud cooperativista discute temas llegados a nuestros y nuestras jóvenes del sector agropecuario y de las localidades del interior de nuestro país en cuales esta presente la cooperativa

Name: Tecnico Departamento de Proyectos Cooperativos

Address: Av. Mal. Mascarenhas de Moraes, N°2501 - Bento Ferreira, Vitória - ES - BRAZIL, ZIP CODE 29050-626
Description: The OCB / ES system is the institution responsible for representing the cooperativism of the state, in addition to offering vocational training actions for cooperative employees and cooperatives. In addition to encouraging the participation of young people in cooperativism.

Name: Sidlakusale Youth Multipurpose Co operative
orgnasationtype: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Sector: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Address: n/a
Description: A vibrant and energetic youth group that grows crops and vegetables for commercial purpose. We are made up of 7 males and 5 females.
Additional Details: For supply of excellent quality and fresh crops and vegetables do not hesitate to talk to us. We would love to tap into exporting our produce in the future. We would also love to collaborate with other youth cooperatives in agriculture and other sectors.

Name: Boresha Sacco Society Ltd.
orgnasationtype: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Sector: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Address: PO Box 80-20103 Eldama Ravine, Market Road, Nakuru, Kenya
Description: Boresha SACCO rebranded from Baringo Teachers Sacco Society limited in the year 2012. The Society has 11 Performing Branches spread over Baringo County in Kenya and Neighbouring Counties. The Eleven Branches are fully Operational namely: Ravine, Kabarnet, Marigat, Mogotio, Kabartonjo, Mochongoi, Barewesa, Eldoret, Chemolingot, Nakuru and Kapsabet. Satellite/Agency Offices are 4 - Tenges, Kipsaraman, Kisanana and Mumberes.
Additional Details: MEMBERSHIP COMPOSITION: Salaried Members - Teachers under Teachers Service Commission (TSC), Civil Servants employed by Public Service Commission, County Governments Staff, KNUT and NGOs Staff, SACCO and its subsidiaries Staff, Retired SACCO Members, Companies and Parastatals Pensionable Staff.  Non Salaried Members Biashara & Kilimo Members – Individual business persons, Micro Enterprises, The General Members of the Community, Micro-credit Members, Farmers (Individuals and groups), Jua Kali business persons, Youth and Women groups and Chamas. Corporates/Institutions - Registered business Entities, Institutions, Schools and Colleges, Churches, Community Based Organizations (CBOs), Cattle Dips, Registered Enterprises Business, Investment Groups and Registered Companies.

Name: Nigerian Youth Cooperative Network
orgnasationtype: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Sector: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Address: c/o LASCOFED BUILDING Plot 6, Isaacstan Close, Off Wempco Road, Ogba Industrial Scheme, Ogba-Ikeja, Lagos State, Nigeria
Description: The Nigerian Youth Cooperative Network (NYCN-COOP) is the apex body representing the Youth Co-operative Movement in Nigeria (both in and out of school youth). www.youthincoops.org The main activities of the NYCN-COOP is to propagate and spread the gospel of cooperation, its principles and practices, promote co-operative education, carry out research and disseminate information among cooperators and the public masses in Nigeria (mostly among in & out of school youths) with and for the purpose of creating awareness, informing and re-orientating them about cooperatives, advocating, developing and organizing students and youth cooperatives, also to represent the emerging youth co-operative movement nationally and internationally, and to provide management, consultancy and other advisory services for such cooperatives. Furthermore, NYCN-COOP studies the nature and workings of the International Co-operative Alliance (ICA) and the Co-operative Federations in Nigeria, to promote its ideals and principles through conferences, workshops, seminars, press release, and other related activities of youths, it’s implication is that this will form a basis for eradication of poverty and unemployment.
Additional Details: The Nigerian Youth Cooperative Network (NYCN-COOP) is the apex body representing the Youth Co-operative Movement in Nigeria (both in and out of school youth). www.youthincoops.org The main activities of the NYCN-COOP is to propagate and spread the gospel of cooperation, its principles and practices, promote co-operative education, carry out research and disseminate information among cooperators and the public masses in Nigeria (mostly among in & out of school youths) with and for the purpose of creating awareness, informing and re-orientating them about cooperatives, advocating, developing and organizing students and youth cooperatives, also to represent the emerging youth co-operative movement nationally and internationally, and to provide management, consultancy and other advisory services for such cooperatives. Furthermore, NYCN-COOP studies the nature and workings of the International Co-operative Alliance (ICA) and the Co-operative Federations in Nigeria, to promote its ideals and principles through conferences, workshops, seminars, press release, and other related activities of youths, it’s implication is that this will form a basis for eradication of poverty and unemployment.

Name: North American Students of Cooperation (NASCO)
orgnasationtype: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Sector: Network for youth in the cooperative movement
Address: 1100 W Cermak Rd #514 Chicago, IL 60608 USA
Description: Since 1968, NASCO has been working with students, housing co-ops, worker-owners, activists, and community members who are interested in applying cooperative principles to meet their needs and fulfill their missions. NASCO is the network that facilitates mutual aid and support amongst co-ops.
Additional Details: NASCO organizes and educates affordable group equity co-ops and their members for the purpose of promoting a community-oriented cooperative movement. We are a membership organization of about 50 member cooperatives, representing roughly 4,000 cooperators across the US and Canada.

Name: Rwanda Cooperatives Professionals
Address: KK503 St, Ngoma cell, Kicukiro Sector, Kicukiro district, Kigali city, Rwanda
Description: Drawing on the skills and expertise of an experienced and knowledgeable staffs. Rwanda Coops Pro also provides consulting on a fee-for-service basis and is often successful in helping coops secure autonomy. Rwanda cooperatives Professionals vision and mission statements.
Additional Details: Rwanda cooperatives professionals (hereinafter called Rwanda Coops Pro). Rwanda cooperatives professionals is a non government organization that was founded by cooperatives professionals in September 2018. Since the foundation, Rwanda CoopsPro has been committed to providing a range of innovative, results-oriented, and cost-effective services to cooperatives and related organizations. Vision: We envisions at getting Rwandans working together cooperatively and responsibly to achieve their social and economic well-being through organizations they control. Mission: To partner and speeds-up development and strengthen cooperatives movement in Rwanda by providing highly effective development services to existing and new cooperatives.

Name: Global Communities (formerly CHF International)
Address:
8601 Georgia Avenue Suite 300
Silver Spring, MD 20910, USA
Description: Our mission is to create long-lasting, positive and community-led change that improves the lives and livelihoods of vulnerable people across the globe. Our central goal is to build the capacity of communities to direct the development of their own lives and livelihoods. Empowered communities are able to drive change when they recognize everyone’s needs, understand their rights and the natural and market forces that affect them, and are able to take collective action. Once empowered, communities are better able to build constructive relationships with government institutions, the private sector and civil society in ways that are sustainable. In turn, local government, the private sector and civil society have a greater ability to address community needs.

Name: Economic and Social Development Center of Palestine ESDC
Address: Al-Balou', Al-Bireh, Ramallah, West Bank, 4518 Al-Bireh, Palestine
Description: The Economic and Social Development Center of Palestine (ESDC) is a Palestinian development-oriented NGO with vast experiences in the both development and humanitarian cooperation. It was established in 2003. ESCD works in all geographic locations of the West Bank and Gaza Strip ESDC is the only local NGO in Palestine that focuses specifically on the development of cooperatives, CBO’s and working groups as well as individual farmers. ESDC focuses on aggregating the split resource through cooperative concepts. ESDC found that the cooperative model is the most appropriate model for developing the Palestinian economy, which characterized by small size and of ownership, scattered resources and small produces.
Additional Details: Services: Services offered through the Institutional Capacity Building Program: 1. Training cooperatives and community economic organizations is available to employees, board of directors, oversight bodies and members of the founding committees and leaders of the cooperative and institutions 2. Community socio-economic organization are supported in business development and services 3. Entrepreneur initiatives have the financial and material resources required for the establishment of projects or the development of cooperative services. 4. Awareness and training for cooperatives and economic CBOs is available to employees, boards of directors, oversight bodies and members of the founding committees of the leading organizations and the cooperative members. 5. Cooperative have opportunities to promote & market cooperative products locally and externally:. 6. The quality of the products and services of cooperatives and CBOs are improved: 7. Networking and exchange visits of socio-economic organizations locally and externally conducted. 8. Business development services provided. 9. Women and youth entrepreneurs have the financial and material resources necessary to set up or develop their small projects. 10. International initiatives to sign contracts for the marketing of entrepreneurial products at fair prices are promoted. 11. Small producers are organized in an economic and social framework that contributes to their protection and development of their businesses. Services offered through the Livelihood and Food Security Program consists of: 1. Technical training for farmers and livestock breeders and the means to produce efficiently and sustainably within national and international quality standards. 2. Increasing awareness and confidence in fresh and processed local agricultural products. 3. Increasing access to agriculture, natural resources and traditional and non-traditional water sources. 4. Financial support is available to families affected and threatened with loss of natural resources 5. Interventions that respond to the needs of farmers living in support of their livelihood strategy based on agriculture or livestock is implemented. 6. Restoring Palestinian farming activities affected by the occupation practices and natural disasters. 7. Backyard agro-production units for home - based food production. 8. Spreading Good farming practices 9. Establishment and technical support of establishing Village Savings and Lending Schemes.

Name: Rubio & Rubio
Address: 3rd Floor Joy Nostalg No. 17 ADB Ave., Ortigas Pasig City, 1500 Manila Philippines
Description: We are a tax and accounting firm with special focus on international tax and local tax defense, as well as involvement in forensic accounting. We uphold our corporate social responsibility by supporting cooperatives, particularly in helping the youth in organizing their cooperatives, in helping them realize their value in the global economy through cooperativism.
Additional Details: We are an accredited audit firm of the Cooperative Development Authority of the Philippines. This accreditation enables us to conduct social audit on cooperatives, as well as financial statement audits. Our knowledge gained through accreditation allows us to provide guidance to cooperatives in their governance and sustainability.

Name: Acteurs Pour une Economie Solidaire au Togo (APES-Togo)
Address: Avenue Pya, Rue des pavée Adidoadin, Immeuble SOSSOU, Lomé-Togo
Description: L’Agence associative de promotion de l’entrepreneuriat coopératif, Acteurs Pour une Économie Solidaire au Togo (APES-Togo) a été fondée le 12 Août 2011, du désir d’un groupe de jeunes de promouvoir l’Économie Sociale et Solidaire (ESS), à travers l’entrepreneuriat coopératif au Togo. Elle est enregistrée dans le registre des associations togolaises, sous le récépissé N°0022/MATDCL-SG-DLPAP-DOCA. Elle a pour mission de participer au développement social et économique du Togo en favorisant le plein épanouissement du mouvement coopératif et mutualiste togolais et ce, en accord avec les principes et les valeurs de l'Alliance Coopérative Internationale. Pour réaliser cette mission, APES-Togo : Mènent des plaidoyers en faveurs de la mise en place de programmes dédiés à la promotion de l'entrepreneuriat coopératif des jeunes et des femmes, et à l'accompagnement technique et financier des entreprises coopératives membres du Réseau APES; Effectue la représentation et défend les intérêts de l'ensemble des coopératrices et coopérateurs rassemblés au sein du Réseau APES ; Favorise le développement coopératif et mutualiste, afin de multiplier les effets bénéfiques de la coopération pour ses membres et pour la population. Elle organise chaque 02 ans, le Forum Panafricain de la Jeun'ESS, dont les thématiques touchent la jeunesse africaine - le panafricanisme - la coopération - l'entrepreneuriat coopératif. La deuxième édition aura lieu à Kpalimé, en Octobre 2018 au Togo. Elle est membre de @ESS Forum International et reconnue par l'Alliance Coopérative International/Africa, comme organisme de promotion du model coopératif au Togo.

Name: Worcester Roots
Address: 4 King St Worcester, MA 01610 USA
Description: A grassroots cooperative incubator that runs a yearly Co-op Academy and has run a cooperative education youth leadership program since 2006.
Additional Details: Our first youth initiative was the Toxic Soil Busters. Now our youth team Co-op Connections sells regionally-produced co-op goods and services at events.

Name: Real Youth International
Address: H529 Nokwazi Square Zolani Park Khayelitsha, South Africa
Description: Real Youth International is a non-profit organisation (196 - 614 NPO) inspired to advance the potential of youth and children in South African townships though quality, socially-effective programmes.
Additional Details: Due to the culture of the community, the organisation is challenged to meet sound management, thus the online mapping will provide similar cases to compare and learn to reach sustainability.

Name: Association of Cooperative Educators
Address: 1660 S. Highway 100, Suite 500A St. Louis Park, MN 55416-5541 USA
Description: To provide members a forum to highlight programs and practices that increase understanding, innovation and professionalism in cooperative education.Ace benefits cooperative education and the cooperative movement by promoting cooperative research; developing linkages between universities, cooperatives and supporting organizations; building capacity to support the development of innovation and acumen in cooperatives; spreading the word by providing resources on cooperative education.

Name: Co-operative Heritage Trust UK
Address: Attn: Dr. Vivienne Evans c/o Rochdale Pioneers Museum, 31 Toad Lane, Rochdale, Lancashire, OL12 0NU, UK
Description: Research aims to connect various youth groups in Rochdale together and with other international co-op youth groups. This is separate from the Co-op Heritage Trust's own community outreach work in Rochdale and Greater Manchester..

Name: Ihlumelo
Address: 118 Gomery Avenue Summerstrand, Port Elizabeth, South Africa
Description: Company provides targeted business support services focused on vulnerable/marginalised SMMEs, NPO and cooperatives

Name: Centro Internacional de Economia Social y Cooperative
Address: Concha y Toro 32 B, comuna de Santiago, Región Metropolitana, Chile
Description: Centro universitario especializado en economía social y cooperativa.
Additional Details: n/a

Name: Universidad Cooperativa de Colombia- Cooperativa (COMUNA)
Address: kra. 13 no. 37-43 piso 8 Bogotá Colombia
Description: La Universidad Cooperativa de Colombia es una institución auxiliar del cooperativismo de propiedad social, es multicampus y tiene en su visión, misión y plan estratégico compromiso con el fortalecimiento del sector de la economía solidaria. Para ello, realiza actividades desde la educación, la investigación, el emprendimiento solidario y la innovación social desde cada uno de sus programas universitarios y a través de la interdisciplinariedad. Cuenta con 50.000 estudiantes y una red de cerca de 80 educadores, investigadores y emprendedores solidarios que hacen innovación social en territorio
Additional Details: El Instituto de Economía Social y Cooperativismo INDESCO es la célula madre de la Universidad Cooperativa de Colombia, actualmente hace gestión del conocimiento sobre la dinámica de la economía solidaria en la universidad y articula un ecosistema universitario que le permite generar sinergias en y para la economía social y solidaria al nivel nacional e internacional.

Name: Botswana Co-operative Training Centre
Address:
Plot 9103/000/0 Sebele, Next To Rural Training Centre, Gaborone, Botswana
Private Bag 0083, Gaborone, Botswana
Description: Botswana Co-operative Training Centre is the only co-operatives training institution in Botswana. It is in the education and training division in the Department for co-operative Development in the Ministry of Investment, Trade and Industry. It is a 100% government owned training centre. It trains members of the co-operative movement, being employees, general members, board members, employees of the department and also groups that aspire to form co-operatives. It further provides entrepreneurship training to marginalized groups (youth, people living with disabilities, women, and people living in rural/remote areas). The institution offers a level 5 certificate in Co-operative business management and other short courses. All the courses are provided for free, with the government bearing all the costs.

Name: CZM
Address: Nicosia, Cyprus
Description: n/a

Name: LCU-SDGs Cooperative Society
Address: Department of Politics and International Relations, Lead City University, Ibadan, Nigeria c/o LCU-SDGs Academy
Description: It was formed to introduce cooperation and cooperatives to students and youth while they are still in their formative years. It is projected to imbibe into students the art of joining hands in self help to combat the menace of unemployment and disguised unemployment.
Additional Details: Membership is open to all students, especially those of Lead City University and the Federal Cooperative College, both in Ibadan. Many of the student members are not from Ibadan City, they are only there for educational purposes. They are however expected to take the lessons to their home cities and bring feed backs It is basically an offshoot of the LCU-SDGs Academy concept.

Name: Africa Cooperatives University of South Africa
Address: 84 Nehi Street Protea Glen Soweto Johannesburg South Africa
Description: ACU-SA was founded by three community members of Soweto in Protea Glen, South Africa. The founding of this university was influenced by a concern to increase access to quality higher education in South Africa and Africa at large. The kind of higher education that ACU-SA seeks to provide is that which focuses on the principles of a shared economy and grassroot interventions. The programmes of the institution provide skills to work in the community enterprise sector locally and globally. The community enterprise sector is made up of co-operatives, charitable nonprofits, community based structures and non-governmental organisations.
Additional Details: Training our university members to play an active role in the development of resilient, sustainable and futuristic co-operatives, non-profit companies and community based enterprises. Vision: Leading the science and art of research and training community enterprises in Africa and the world, working with the world’s talented academics. ACU shall provide higher education that is accessible to African low-income communities, youth, cooperatives, community workers and adults that were denied an opportunity to obtain higher education either because of their family circumstances and due to systemic injustices of the past. Mission: The mission of ACU-SA is to train and develop fit-for-service innovators and servants of the community enterprise sector. This mission is to be achieved through education, training, research and community embeddedness. Goals: Enrich the community enterprise with skills for the 21st century and beyond through rigorous formal training and research. Connect the African continent through sectoral development of community enterprises; Create an African global university of choice that addresses issues of global interest about the community enterprise sector, shared economy, climate change and alleviation of poverty; Establish a university brand that underserved communities can identify with through collaboration, consultation and satellite campuses based in such communities; Employ hybrid and blended research based teaching methods to empower students with practical and futuristic skills set for the 21st century community enterprise sector.

Name: Moshi Co-operative University
Address:
Moshi Co-operative University (MoCU)
Sokoine Road, P.O. Box 474, Moshi. Tanzania. East Africa.
Description: Moshi Co-operative University (MoCU) history dates back from 1963 when it was a co-operative college. It is the only university in the Sub-Saharan region that offers co-operative and business education both in undergraduate and postgraduate levels. MoCU results from upgrading the former Moshi Cooperative College into MUCCoBS, a Constituent College of Sokoine University of Agriculture (SUA) in May 2004 and in 2014 it received its full autonomy. Consequently, also the name changed to Moshi Co-operative University (MoCU). This is the oldest training institution in Tanzania, accumulating experience of 43 years, in the fields of co-operative accounting, co-operative management and rural development. During this period, the University has been grooming experts in co-operative development, accounting, management, marketing, auditing who are employed in different institutions within and outside Tanzania. The greatest obligation of the University is to provide the best possible education for our students, developing their intellect,equipping them with the appropriate knowledge and skills and preparing them for lifetime learning so that they become what the society needs. MoCU aims to be Tanzania's most progressive University locally and internationally; recognized for the relevance, innovation and responsiveness of its teaching and learning, research, partnerships and international activities. Similarly, the University is committed to the promotion of equity, access, equal opportunities, redress, transformation and diversity, as well as active and constructive involvement in community development and service. MoCU has regional offices for extension and outreach services in 13 regions in Tanzania serving the whole country mainly co-operatives and also other clients like CBOs, NGOs, economic groups, individuals and public institutions

Name: UK Co-operative College
Address: Holyoake House, Hanover Street, Manchester M60 0AS UK
Description: The Co-operative College is an education charity, which through co-operative education, values and principles, aims to build a fairer world.
Additional Details: Youth is an important strand to the work of the UK Co-operative College. We provide course to support young people in skills development, both funded by UK organisations and as part of EU funded projects. We deliver UK projects to support disadvantaged young people explore setting up co-operatives of all forms and to develop pro co-operative behaviours. This is currently funded by governmental, co-operative and non-co-operative donors. We are also heavily engaged in International Co-operative Development, supporting co-operatives and communities improve their circumstances. Much of our work focuses on empowering under represented groups should as women and young people. We are currently work in Malawi, Rwanda, Zambia and Sri Lanka and has been funded by governmental and co-operative donors.

Name: AIMCOOP
Address: Bayan ng Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur
Description: A CDA Registered Cooperative with Reg. No. 9520-09003001. The First ISO Certified Primary Cooperative in the Philippines with ID No. 9105083218. With 79 offices serving the 1.1 million members nationwide from Luzon, Visayas and Mindanao. AIMCOOP celebrated its 50th year anniversary in August 2017.
Additional Details: Active Member of ACCU in the Asia Pacific; Active Member of MASS-SPECC & NATCCO Federations in the Philippines; Accredited Partner of DTI, PCIC, SSS (Government Agencies in the Philippines.
